nodes.text: Infinite exponential economic growth is essential for the survival and conservation of our economy and civilization and is both possible and required
The two dominant perspectives on growth (anti-growth based on entropy limits and pro-growth based on limitless knowledge/dualism) are limited, subjective, and cannot resolve the controversy

A broader frame centered on the universal process of creation (equilibration producing new levels of organization) reconciles and subsumes both perspectives and explains why exponential infinite growth is necessary
Conservation of any system requires access to new resources, which is achieved only by creating new, more powerful levels of organization that provide new possibilities and degrees of freedom
Economic growth is primarily about value creation via the generation of radically new properties (novelties) produced by human mental operations that follow the universal creation process

Anti-growth perspective assigns ontological primacy to entropy and equilibration, treating entropy solely as depletion and leading to policy recommendations (limits on production, consumption, population) that are painful and insufficient
Pro-growth perspective relies on a dualist distinction exempting mental production from entropy and overemphasizes technology and market signals as sufficient to avoid natural limits
Equilibration (entropy production) both dissipates energy and enables formation of new combinations and higher levels of organization; entropy is not only destructive but also generative

The process of creation produces exponential combinatoric growth: n functional operations combine to yield approximately n squared combinations, producing exponential increases in organizational power
Conscious, intentional engagement of human consciousness with the process of creation is necessary to translate mental-level exponential increases into economic production and conservation
If exponential growth is not maintained, conservation fails: productivity declines exponentially, resource depletion accelerates exponentially, and population pressures rise exponentially
Translating exponential increases in mental/organizational power into material production allows access to new resources and reduces per-capita material consumption even as GDP grows

Mental operations originate in physical sensory-motor operations and therefore involve entropy production and resource depletion (though not only as energy dissipation but as depletion of disequilibrium possibilities)

Value creation consists of emergence of new properties via creation of new combinations; economic activity should be organized around the process of creation to make production and consumption complementary and efficient

Evidence and empirical results (e.g., Bloom et al.) show research productivity per researcher has fallen and ideas are getting harder to find, implying mental production has resource-like limits and requires exponential increase in effort to sustain linear growth
